DOC.brief_summary: Objective : Acute urinary retention ( AUR ) common problem hospitalize patient . Either indwell urethral catheterization clean intermittent catheterization ( CIC ) choice treatment . In chronic urinary retention , physician prefer CIC chronic indwell urethral catheter basis claim rate catheter-associated urinary tract infection ( CAUTI ) low . Method : The patient randomize indwell urethral catheter CIC group . The primary outcome study catheter-associated asymptomatic bacteriuria CAUTI . The secondary outcome pain , hematuria , cloudy urine , quality life .
DOC.brief_title: Indwelling Urinary Catheterization Versus Clean Intermittent Catheterization Short-term Management Hospitalized Patients With Transient Acute Urinary Retention
DOC.detailed_description: We query hospitalized patient Ramathibodi Hospital develop first-time AUR June 2014 May 2015 . Patients 18 year age history urinary retention , urinary tract infection , poor compliance exclude study . All patient give write informed consent . The patient randomly divide two group depend type assign intervention : CIC indwell urethral catheter group . All patient follow 2 week ; urinalysis urine culture obtain time AUR whenever patient develop UTI-associated symptom . The patient positive urine culture time AUR exclude study .
